Rich,
What are the kanji for that Masayuki?  I don't find any Shoami Masayuki listed after a cursory check, but there are Bushu Ito, Choshu and others signing with various kanji that read that way.

BTW, masa is an extremely common first kanji in Ito school names.  Not saying that proves anything, just a "factoid."

Jim



  Out of interest, I had this message from a mate over night.

  " Rich, I have this piece but without the nunome intact papered to 
  Masayuki-den by NTHK (Shoami). Nice wak tsuba in my case. Hope this helps. "


  Rich
